required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effect of AZD5069 in Patients With Bronchiectasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Study to Assess the Efficacy of 28-Day Oral Administration of AZD5069 Twice Daily in Patients With Bronchiectasis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of AZD5069 in patients with bronchiectasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Absolute Neutrophil Cell Count in Sputum at End of Treatment Compared to Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment values from 3 visits (day 21 to 28) and baseline values from 3 visits.
primary_outcome.description: Ratio of the mean of 3 visits at the end of the treatment period to the mean of the 3 baseline visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of the Percentage Neutrophil Cell Count in Sputum at End of Treatment Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment values from 3 visits (day 21 to 28) and baseline values from 3 visits.
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of the mean of 3 visits at the end of the treatment period to the mean of the 3 baseline visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Weight of 24-hour Sputum Collection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients collected all sputum produced during a 24-hour period at baseline and Day 28.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Slow Vital Capacity (SVC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: Lung function tests consisted of 3 forced expiratory maneuvers in which the patient expired forcefully from total lung capacity to residual volume, recorded using a spirometer. SVC is the measure of the change in volume of gas in the lungs from complete inspiration to complete expiration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: Lung function tests consisted of 3 forced expiratory maneuvers in which the patient expired forcefully from total lung capacity to residual volume, recorded using a spirometer. FVC is the maximum volume of air which can be exhaled or inspired during a forced maneuver.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: Lung function tests consisted of 3 forced expiratory maneuvers in which the patient expired forcefully from total lung capacity to residual volume, recorded using a spirometer. FEV1 is the volume expired in the first second of maximal expiration after a full inspiration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Flow Between 25% and 75% of Forced Vital Capacity (FEF25-75)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: Lung function tests consisted of 3 forced expiratory maneuvers in which the patient expired forcefully from total lung capacity to residual volume, recorded using a spirometer. FEF25-75 is flow rate during the middle half of forced vital capacity (25%-75% of the total volume (FVC) exhaled).

secondary_outcome.measure: Transition Dyspnea Index (TDI) at End of Treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: TDI measures changes in dyspnea severity from the baseline as established by the Baseline Dyspnea Index (BDI). TDI is an interviewer-administered rating of severity of dyspnea that assesses Change in Functional Impairment, Change in Magnitude of Task, and Change in Magnitude of Effort domains on a 7-point scale ranging from -3 (major deterioration) to +3 (major improvement). Total score ranges from -9 to +9. The lower the score, the more deterioration in severity of dyspnea.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for the Morning PEF and Evening PEF of the Bronkotest Diary Card
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Last 7 days on treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Bronkotest diary card is a paper based diary card that was filled out by patients daily, recording values from morning and evening peak expiratory flow (PEF) measurements and answering 8 questions on signs and symptoms. Summary statistics for baseline (mean of the last 7 days prior to first dose) and change (mean of the last 7 days on treatment - baseline) only contain patients included in the analysis. For symptom scores a decrease is an improvement, for PEF an increase is an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for the Symptom Scores of the Bronkotest Diary Card
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Last 7 days on treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Bronkotest diary card is a paper based diary card that was filled out by patients daily, recording values from morning and evening peak expiratory flow (PEF) measurements and answering 8 questions on signs and symptoms. Symptom scores were recorded for night-time symptoms, breathing, sputum colour, sputum amount, sputum type, wellbeing, number of puffs of inhalers, and cough, generally scored on a scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 4 (worst symptoms). Summary statistics for baseline (mean of the last 7 days prior to first dose) and change (mean of the last 7 days on treatment - baseline) only contain patients included in the analysis. For symptom scores a decrease is an improvement, for PEF an increase is an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Total and Domain Scores in St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire for COPD Patients (SGRQ-C)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: SGRQ-C total score shows the impact of COPD on patient's health status, and expressed as a percentage of impairment with scale from 0 (best health status) to 100 (worst possible status). The SGRQ-C contains 3 domains: Symptom (distress due to respiratory symptoms), Activity (disturbance of physical activity) and Impact (overall impact on daily life and well being). All three domains with scale from 0 (best health status) to 100 (worst possible status).

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Interleukin-1 Beta (IL-1β) in Sputum at End of Treatment Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment values from 3 visits (day 21 to 28) and baseline values from 3 visits.
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of the mean of 3 visits at the end of the treatment period to the mean of the 3 baseline visits.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male, or female of non-child bearing potential; ie, women who are permanently or surgically sterilised or post-menopausal.
- Aged 18 to 80 years inclusive at screening (Visit 1)
- Have a clinical diagnosis of idiopathic or post infective bronchiectasis as diagnosed with a historical high resolution computerised tomography (HRCT) or bronchogram
- Be sputum producers with a history of chronic expectoration on most days of most weeks of the year. Patients should have a history of spontaneously producing sputum on a daily basis and should be able to provide at least 2 of the 3 required baseline sputum samples with an average of 3 mL or more.
- Be on a stable treatment regimen, as judged by the investigator.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any clinically significant disease or disorder
- Patients with other latent or chronic infections or at risk of infection within 90 days before Visit 2
- An acute exacerbation or acute respiratory infection (upper or lower) requiring oral steroids or antibiotics within 30 days prior to Visit 2
- An FEV1 of <30% of predicted normal at Visit 1
- Patients who have received live or live-attenuated vaccine in the 2 weeks prior to dosing (Visit 2)
- Concomitant diagnosis of significant pulmonary disease other than bronchiectasis or COPD, including symptomatic asthma and allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis
- Bronchiectasis associated with a generalised immunodeficiency disorder, where manifestations other than bronchiectasis predominate

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This multicenter study was conducted in Europe between 27 December 2010 and 13 February 2012.

Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized

outcome.title: Ratio of Absolute Neutrophil Cell Count in Sputum at End of Treatment Compared to Baseline
outcome.description: Ratio of the mean of 3 visits at the end of the treatment period to the mean of the 3 baseline visits.
outcome.time_frame: End of treatment values from 3 visits (day 21 to 28) and baseline values from 3 visits.
outcome.population: The PD analysis set comprised all patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication and for whom PD samples (absolute and percentage neutrophil cell count in sputum, sputum collection weight, inflammatory markers in sputum and serum) were available (assumed not to be affected by factors such as protocol violations).

measure.title: Ratio of Absolute Neutrophil Cell Count in Sputum at End of Treatment Compared to Baseline
measure.description: Ratio of the mean of 3 visits at the end of the treatment period to the mean of the 3 baseline visits.
measure.population: The PD analysis set comprised all patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication and for whom PD samples (absolute and percentage neutrophil cell count in sputum, sputum collection weight, inflammatory markers in sputum and serum) were available (assumed not to be affected by factors such as protocol violations).

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of covariance included treatment, inhaled corticosteroids, Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection, and baseline as covariates. The analysis was done on log-transformed data. The results were back-transformed after the analysis on the log scale.
analysis.param_type: Ratio of AZD5069 80 mg to placebo

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Weight of 24-hour Sputum Collection
outcome.description: Patients collected all sputum produced during a 24-hour period at baseline and Day 28.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (Day 28)
outcome.population: The PD analysis set comprised all patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication and for whom PD samples (absolute and percentage neutrophil cell count in sputum, sputum collection weight, inflammatory markers in sputum and serum) were available (assumed not to be affected by factors such as protocol violations).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Weight of 24-hour Sputum Collection
measure.description: Patients collected all sputum produced during a 24-hour period at baseline and Day 28.
measure.population: The PD analysis set comprised all patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication and for whom PD samples (absolute and percentage neutrophil cell count in sputum, sputum collection weight, inflammatory markers in sputum and serum) were available (assumed not to be affected by factors such as protocol violations).

analysis.groups_desc: The 24-hour sputum weight on Visit 4 was compared between groups using ANCOVA (additive model) with treatment and inhaled corticosteroids/P. aeruginosa infection as fixed effects and baseline as a covariate.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Slow Vital Capacity (SVC)
outcome.description: Lung function tests consisted of 3 forced expiratory maneuvers in which the patient expired forcefully from total lung capacity to residual volume, recorded using a spirometer. SVC is the measure of the change in volume of gas in the lungs from complete inspiration to complete expiration.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of treatment (Day 28)
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis set included all patients who were randomized (defined as having a randomization code recorded on the demography case report form), received at least one dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for at least one efficacy endpoint.

outcome.title: Transition Dyspnea Index (TDI) at End of Treatment (Day 28)
outcome.description: TDI measures changes in dyspnea severity from the baseline as established by the Baseline Dyspnea Index (BDI). TDI is an interviewer-administered rating of severity of dyspnea that assesses Change in Functional Impairment, Change in Magnitude of Task, and Change in Magnitude of Effort domains on a 7-point scale ranging from -3 (major deterioration) to +3 (major improvement). Total score ranges from -9 to +9. The lower the score, the more deterioration in severity of dyspnea.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of treatment (Day 28)
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis set included all patients who were randomized (defined as having a randomization code recorded on the demography case report form), received at least one dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for at least one efficacy endpoint.

measure.title: Transition Dyspnea Index (TDI) at End of Treatment (Day 28)
measure.description: TDI measures changes in dyspnea severity from the baseline as established by the Baseline Dyspnea Index (BDI). TDI is an interviewer-administered rating of severity of dyspnea that assesses Change in Functional Impairment, Change in Magnitude of Task, and Change in Magnitude of Effort domains on a 7-point scale ranging from -3 (major deterioration) to +3 (major improvement). Total score ranges from -9 to +9. The lower the score, the more deterioration in severity of dyspnea.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis set included all patients who were randomized (defined as having a randomization code recorded on the demography case report form), received at least one dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for at least one efficacy endpoint.

analysis.groups_desc: The ANCOVA model used TDI as the response variable with treatment, inhaled corticosteroids, Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection and BDI as covariates.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline for the Morning PEF and Evening PEF of the Bronkotest Diary Card
outcome.description: The Bronkotest diary card is a paper based diary card that was filled out by patients daily, recording values from morning and evening peak expiratory flow (PEF) measurements and answering 8 questions on signs and symptoms. Summary statistics for baseline (mean of the last 7 days prior to first dose) and change (mean of the last 7 days on treatment - baseline) only contain patients included in the analysis. For symptom scores a decrease is an improvement, for PEF an increase is an improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Last 7 days on treatment
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis set included all patients who were randomized (defined as having a randomization code recorded on the demography case report form), received at least one dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for at least one efficacy endpoint.

Night time symptom score: Analysis of covariance includes treatment, inhaled corticosteroids, Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection and baseline as covariates.

Type of sputum: Analysis of covariance included treatment, inhaled corticosteroids, Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection and baseline as covariates.
How do you feel?: Analysis of covariance includes treatment, inhaled corticosteroids, Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection and baseline as covariates.
Number of puffs of inhalers: Analysis of covariance includes treatment, inhaled corticosteroids, Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection and baseline as covariates.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
